customers.title: Customer Analysis (RFM)
customers.rfm_explanation: RFM Analysis segments customers based on Recency, Frequency, and Monetary value
customers.segment_explanation:
üí° **What is RFM?** Your customers are divided into 9 strategic segments based on:
- **Recency**: How recently they purchased
- **Frequency**: How often they purchase
- **Monetary**: How much they spend

Use these segments to target each group with personalized marketing strategies.

cohorts.title: Cohort Analysis & Retention
cohorts.description: Track customer retention by first purchase month
cohorts.explanation:
üí° **Cohort Retention:** This heatmap shows what percentage of customers from each cohort (first purchase month) continued to make purchases in subsequent months. Darker blues = higher retention.

**How to read it:**
- Each row is a cohort (customers who first purchased in that month)
- Each column shows retention X months after first purchase
- High retention = loyal customer base
- Low retention = need better retention strategies
cohorts.no_cohort_data: ‚ö†Ô∏è **Insufficient data for cohort analysis.** Cohort analysis requires customers with multiple purchases over time. Your data shows mostly one-time purchasers or a short time period.

Champions.name: Champions
Champions.description: Best customers who bought recently, buy often and spend the most
actions: Reward them with exclusive offers and early access to new products
Make them brand ambassadors through referral programs

Loyal Customers.name: Loyal Customers
Loyal Customers.description: Loyal customers with good recency and high frequency
actions: Offer bundle deals and cross-sell opportunities

Potential Loyalists.name: Potential Loyalists
Potential Loyalists.description: Recent customers with potential to become loyal

New Customers.name: New Customers
New Customers.description: New customers who bought recently but not frequently
actions: Create welcome campaigns and onboarding flows
Offer first-time buyer incentives for repeat purchases
Share brand story and product education
Collect feedback on first purchase experience
Provide helpful tips and usage guides

Promising.name: Promising
Promising.description: Recent buyers with low frequency and monetary value
actions: Offer starter packages or sample products
Create educational content about product benefits
Offer small discounts for next purchase

Need Attention.name: Need Attention
Need Attention.description: Good frequency but low monetary value
actions: Offer bundle deals to increase order value

About to Sleep.name: About to Sleep
About to Sleep.description: Below average recency with good frequency and monetary
actions: Send re-engagement campaigns with special offers
Share new product launches and updates
Ask for feedback on why they haven't purchased recently

At Risk.name: At Risk
At Risk.description: High value customers who haven't purchased recently
actions: Offer significant discounts or free shipping
Reach out personally via phone or email

Cannot Lose Them.name: Cannot Lose Them
Cannot Lose Them.description: High value and frequency customers at risk of churning
actions: Immediate personal outreach from account manager

Hibernating.name: Hibernating
Hibernating.description: Low recency and frequency but still valuable

Lost.name: Lost
Lost.description: Customers who haven't bought recently, infrequently and low value
actions: Focus on broad brand awareness rather than direct sales
Offer significant discounts if budget allows
